item.title: Wrap up of HotCarbon'25
item.description:
HotCarbon’25 was a vibrant success! Thank you to all authors and participants for the great interaction.
You can find all the workshop’s papers and some of the authors’ presentations on the 2025 page.

Stay tuned for the 2026 edition!

item.title: Preliminary program is up!
item.description:
The workshop program is now available!

HotCarbon’25 is trilled to announce that its program will feature a second keynote from Le Xie (Harvard) entitled The Interplay between AI and Electric Power Systems.

item.title: Registration is now open!
item.description:
Please note! In-person participant must register before July 7th to be allowed entry in the workshop building!

You can now register via eventbrite.

item.title: Keynote from Daniel S. Berger
item.description:
HotCarbon’25 is trilled to announce that its program will feature a keynote from Daniel S. Berger, from Microsoft Azure Systems Research.

Stay tuned for the detailed program and registration info (very) soon!

item.description: There will be a slight delay in the paper decision notification. Our apologies. Hang on, it’s coming soon!

item.title: CfP out & Venue confirmed!
item.description:
The HotCarbon 2025 Call for Papers is out! Submission deadline is May 12, 2025.

The workshop will take place on July 10-11th 2025 at the Microsoft NERD center, Cambridge, MA, USA.
Check out the Attend page for more details.

item.title: Get ready for HotCarbon'25!
item.description:
After the success of its third edition, HotCarbon will be back in 2025 with a 1.5 day program! (or even 2 days, if necessary). Like in previous editions, the workshop will be collocated with OSDI and take place on July 10 and 11 in Cambridge, MA, USA.

We are delighted to have Timo Hoenig and Abel Souza as co-chairs of the 2025 program committee.
Stay tuned for the CfP!
